args:
Recently, in the capital, Valyx called upon
Leif just before he set out for Chanzelia.
He'd seen through Leif's intention to escape
and link up with the prince and his allies,
but through their conversation he senses his
resolve, and opts to overlook the transgression.
While the prince and his party are busy at\nLake Reeve, events unfold in the capital...
The patrol of the capital is complete,\nGeneral Valyx. No signs of anything\nunusual detected.
Still, it's a shame we've had to deface\nthis beautiful city by turning it into a\ndefensive bulwark like this.
Is aught on your mind, soldier?

I just don't understand why Empress Zethia
keeps us on this course of violence, sir.
She even took the name of the ancient
empire that worshipped the Other!
You care not for the name Dyrenell?
I'd prefer not to be lumped in with\na group that worships the Other, sir.\nWhy must we obey that fell creature?

If we're forced to continue to accept such
humiliations, perhaps it would be better
to break with the Empress and join forces
with the seventh scion instead.
Are you merely thinking aloud, soldier,\nor are you proffering advice to me?
Eeep! I w-would never be so forward, sir!\nI was merely thinking aloud, as you say!
Then I suggest you keep your tongue from\nwagging, lest you lose it. Dismissed.
He posed that selfsame question to me.\nWhat is he doing now, I wonder?
Ah, General Valyx. I fear I have received\na sudden summons from Princess Chelle,\nand so make for Chanzelia.

And yet you stand with the whole of the
White Sparrows at your back. It must be
a dire need indeed if she saw fit to
summon the lot of you.
All is as Princess Chelle commands.\nWe shall make haste back to the capital\nas soon as our duty is done.
Enough with the shameless theater.\nI know you'll not be returning here.
You and your entire order have plans to\ndecamp the Dyrenell Empire for good.
Your ultimate destination is the Halidom,\nwhere you will join ranks with my brother.\nHave I seen to the heart of you yet?
Your eyes see much, Your Highness.\nI can hide nothing from you.
Indeed you cannot. And in that case...
You are henceforth named as\ntraitors to the Empire.
I have no intention to cross blades with\nyou, General. Pray sheathe your weapon.

You would have me stand unarmed in front
of a man who has chosen revolt? Clearly
you are willing to cross blades with me
if it means seeing your will done this day.
I am of course prepared to fight.\nBut I also expect you yourself\nare loath to do so now.

Go then. Leave the capital at once.
If I am bade to dispatch you by the
Empress, things will not end as
peaceably as all this.
General Valyx, why do you remain in the\ncapital at the beck and call of the Other?
The warped yoke we bear under the Other's\npatronage can never bring true peace.
Surely a man such as yourself\nmust see this for the truth it is.
I wield force and might as a cudgel in\nservice to my kingdom—the leader of\nthat kingdom is of no interest to me.
I cut down any who would threaten the\npeace of my people, and will continue\nto do this so long as I draw breath.
You have the disposition of a true solider\nand a man of honor. It suits you well.

I remember when the two of us would
train in the sword—the mere sight of
your advancing was almost enough
to overwhelm me some days!
You sweated out your very blood,\nso eagerly did you train. You gave\nyour all to master the arts of war.

My elder brother and sister do not want
for wisdom—yet I was ever afraid that
selfsame wisdom would be the knife
that cleaved our kingdom in twain.
That is why I trained myself: So I could be\npeer to them. So I would not be inferior.\nBut somehow {player_name}...

Truly, one never knows what talents a
person may hold. I'd thought that little
brother of mine kind but weak, yet look
at him now...
A beacon of light—though as yet a meager\none. But one which exudes the radiance\nwe need to guide us in these dark days.
You are that taken with him, then?\nSo be it. Do as you desire and go.
I will stay here, lead the armies, and\nprotect the land—even if it means being\nlooked down upon as a pawn of the Other.
Then your mind is decided, General?
If we follow the paths we each believe in,\nlet us hope they cross again in the future.
If you join the forces of my brother,\nI fear our reunion will be a bloody one.
For if we meet in the fields of battle,\nour comradeship will not avail you.\nI will crush you, body and soul.
Should it come to that, General Valyx,\nI am prepared to face you as a knight.
I will be off, then. May Ilia guide you.
Stay strong. Stay alive. For I would\nhave the chance to end you myself.
(The time approaches when New Alberia\nand the Dyrenell Empire will settle their\nscores for good and all.)
(As a general of the Empire, I will hold to\nmy cause, even as others ridicule me\nas narrow-minded and stubborn.)
A messenger brings word that an unknown\ngroup approaches our upper border.
So that northern nation moves at last, eh?
Their numbers appear too few\nto be a full invasion force, sir.

I shall ascertain that for myself.
Once I secure permission from the
Empress, we strike for the north.
Make ready for the departure.
I know not who these strangers are,\nbut I will grant no quarter to any\nthat might threaten this land...
